page.title: 09THE CYCLE TRACK WEST OF BATH
page.content: The cycle track was once a working railway line. In 1966 it was closed down by British Rail. A group known as {Cycle Bag}transformed the line into a cycle track in 1979 for people to cycle the five and a half miles to Bitton. In 1985 it was extended to Bristol. From the cycle track you can see the Caravan Park, the Boating Station and nearby farmland. Quite a lot of plants grow along the cycle track. Some of the common plants are bugle, buttercups, vetch, red campion, ladies' lace, dandelions, plantain, black meddic, goosegrass, thistle and herb Robert. There are also forget-me-nots, ox-eye daises, speedwell, woody nightshade and wild strawberries. Trees have been planted along the track but most of them are still young.
